title: Angie Colip column: Three added to the Anderson Bowling Hall of Fame
text:
Angie Colip Posted: Thursday, October 1, 2015 8:21 pm Angie Colip column: Three added to the Anderson Bowling Hall of Fame By Angie Colip | For The Herald Bulletin Herald Bulletin 
The Anderson Bowling Association has announced three names for entry into the local chapter of the Bowling Hall of Fame. 
They are Lionel Stewart, Dwight Elrod, and Nancy Norton. Each of these bowlers have many accomplishments, too many to list in this column, but I will give you some of the highlights of each bowlers career to show why they are deserving of this honor. 
Lionel Stewart has served as President of the local Association along with many other duties while a member of the board. Lionel is also an accomplished bowler having shot a 300 for his high game and over forty 700 series. Lionel has participated in many professional senior regional events and carries a Senior PBA card. 
He has coached high school bowling and bowled on the US Army team. He is a Life Member of the Anderson Bowling Association and is a Squad Leader of the Indiana State Seniors Tournament. He continues to bowl in the Indiana State Masters and multiple leagues. 
Dwight Elrod has also shot a perfect 300 game and has a high series 771. Dwight has bowled in numerous leagues during his career with a high average 205. Elrod has held the office of Vice President and Secretary/Treasurer in several leagues over the years. He is a certified instructor and enjoys teaching the sport of bowling. Elrod is a quiet man who always has a smile and kind word for everyone he meets. 
Nancy Norton will be the only female bowler entering into the Hall of Fame. Norton will be honored posthumously as she passed away in 2014. She served as President, Vice President and Sgt.-at-Arms in many leagues over a 15 year span. 
Norton was a member of the Anderson WBA and USBC Associations for more than 35 years. She accomplished a 266 high game and 722 high series. Even her battle with cancer and chemotherapy sessions couldn’t keep her off the lanes. One day after a session, Nancy decided to bowl one game. After that 197 game, she continued on to bowl a 211 and 213 for a 621 series. 
The annual Hall of Fame banquet will be held at the FOP Lodge on Sunday, Oct. 11 at noon. Please see an association member for tickets and help us celebrate the honor of these three deserving individuals. 
We have had some more honor scores reported this last week. Charlie Colip and Jaxon Fetty both have scored well this past week. Charlie shot a 299 game with a 721 series in the Pick Your Partner league on Monday. He put a good shot on the 12th ball but left the 7-pin on a light mixer to finish one pin short of a perfect game. This was Charlie’s second 299 having shot one in the TKO Scholarship Tourney. He may get that perfecto soon if he keeps rolling the ball like he has lately.
